Publisher name: URL to homepage of publisher
Participant in CrossRef's TDM API
URL to the TDM policy
URL to terms and conditions of webpage
Email address denoted at the contact page of the url
Email address of administrator as available from whois command
Whether it is an Open Access publisher (0 = no, 1 = yes)
Whether the T&C specifies under which country's law the usage falls (country acronym, + denotes whether it adds a modifier to include "other countries")
Whether the T&C allows downloading articles for research (0 = no, 1 = yes)
Whether the T&C explicitly allows scraping (0 = no, 1 = yes, NA = no T&C)
Whether the T&C explicitly allows non-commercial scraping (0 = no, 1 = yes, NA = no T&C)
Whether the T&C explicitly allows spidering/crawling (0 = no, 1 = yes, NA = no T&C)
Whether the T&C explicitly allows non-commercial spidering/crawling (0 = no, 1 = yes, NA = no T&C)
URL to tdm policy (if available)
Whether publisher provides a TDM API (0 = no, 1 = yes)
Whether the TDM API is freely available (i.e., no agreement; 0 = no, 1 = yes)
Whether publisher provides a literature dump (0 = no, 1 = yes)
Whether the literature dump is freely available (i.e., no agreement; 0 = no, 1 = yes)
URL to literature dump policy (if available)
Free field to paste noteworthy pieces of the T&C in
